title: Broken Redis client for cluster mode (MOVED Exception)
body:
### Describe the bug

Hi,

there is an issue with the Redis client in cluster mode. Here is my config:
```
quarkus.redis.hosts=redis://localhost:7001,redis://localhost:7002,redis://localhost:7003,redis://localhost:7004,redis://localhost:7005,redis://localhost:7006
quarkus.redis.client-type=cluster
quarkus.redis.replicas=share
```
I have my cluster up and running in local for all those ports:
```
antony@pop-os:~$ redis-cli -c -p 7001
127.0.0.1:7001> CLUSTER INFO
cluster_state:ok
cluster_slots_assigned:16384
cluster_slots_ok:16384
cluster_slots_pfail:0
cluster_slots_fail:0
cluster_known_nodes:6
cluster_size:3
cluster_current_epoch:6
cluster_my_epoch:1
cluster_stats_messages_ping_sent:107731
cluster_stats_messages_pong_sent:107678
cluster_stats_messages_sent:215409
cluster_stats_messages_ping_received:107673
cluster_stats_messages_pong_received:107731
cluster_stats_messages_meet_received:5
cluster_stats_messages_received:215409
total_cluster_links_buffer_limit_exceeded:0
...
antony@pop-os:~$ redis-cli -c -p 7001
127.0.0.1:7001> PING
PONG
antony@pop-os:~$ redis-cli -c -p 7002
127.0.0.1:7001> PING
PONG
antony@pop-os:~$ redis-cli -c -p 7003
127.0.0.1:7003> PING
PONG
...
```
I am running this simple code for testing:
```java
    // get cluster info and create a new field in a map
    @Scheduled(every = "4s", delayed = "3s")
    Uni<Void> test() {
        System.out.println("\nRunning test...");
        return redisClient.execute("CLUSTER", "INFO")
            .invoke(r -> System.out.println("\nCluster Info --->\n: " + r))
            .chain(() -> redisClient.execute("HSET", "myDict", "field-" + UUID.randomUUID(), "val"))
            .onFailure().recoverWithItem(e -> {
                Log.error("Error returned: ", e);
                return null;
            })
            .replaceWithVoid();
    }
```
This is the output I am getting:
```
Cluster Info --->
: cluster_state:ok
cluster_slots_assigned:16384
cluster_slots_ok:16384
cluster_slots_pfail:0
...

2022-10-20 00:26:31,039 ERROR [com.cha.pau.scu.Test] (vert.x-eventloop-thread-1) Error returned: : MOVED 9564 127.0.0.1:7002
```
So I do get the cluster info but any other command fails (I have tried multiple commands). I have tried with different profiles (dev, prod), with `quarkus dev` and running the jar; I always get the same error. After reading a bit it seems like this is just a redirect notification for the client to resend the request to the indicated node (https://redis.io/docs/reference/cluster-spec/), but the quarkus client doesn't do the redirect, it just throws the error. 

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "11.0.16.1" 2022-08-12 LTS
OpenJDK Runtime Environment Corretto-11.0.16.9.1 (build 11.0.16.1+9-LTS)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Corretto-11.0.16.9.1 (build 11.0.16.1+9-LTS, mixed mode)

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.13.0

### Additional information

Redis version:
```
antony@pop-os:~$ redis-server --version
Redis server v=7.0.5 sha=00000000:0 malloc=jemalloc-5.2.1 bits=64 build=82289c7437798a30
antony@pop-os:~$ redis-cli --version
redis-cli 7.0.5
```
To create the cluster I am simply running `create-cluster start` and `create-cluster create` (https://redis.io/docs/manual/scaling/#create-and-use-a-redis-cluster).

##### UPDATE:
Just run it with Redis version 6.2 (cluster mode) and I get the same error.
